isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD MODEL 292, 392, 492 - REASSEMBLE - FIXED MITER

note.para: For reassembly, reverse the order of disassembly, installing new parts as required. The bearing retainer is tightened to remove any possibility of end play or movement. Re-install the locating pin to lock the retainer to the miter cap. It may be necessary to drill a new hole through the cover into the retainer ( Figure 118).

figure.caption: Figure 118. For Reassembly, Reverse Order of Disassembly

step1.para: Press a new seal in the bearing cap with the lip of the seal facing inside. Carefully install the actuating shaft and bearing through the seal and into the bearing cap. Replace bearing retainer and install locking pin ( Figure 119).

figure.caption: Figure 119. Press New Seal in Bearing Cap

step1.para: Re-install the shims on the bearing surface. Install the miter gear, washer, and retaining nut and tighten to 60 ft-lbs. (81 Nm) ( Figure 120).

figure.caption: Figure 120. Re-install Shims on Bearing Surface

step1.para: Re-install the miter housing to the bearing cap.

caution.para: Do not neglect to re-install the bolts and lockwashers inside the miter housing. Tighten all bolts to specifications ( Figure 121).

figure.caption: Figure 121. Tighten All Bolts to Specifications

step1.para: Reassemble miter housing cover using new gaskets and seals as required. Re-align all reference marks made during disassembly and install all locking pins ( Figure 122).
Install the reassembled miter cover into miter housing with shim pack/gaskets removed during disassembly and secure with two bolts and lockwashers ( Figure 123).

figure.caption: Figure 123. Install Miter Cover into Miter Housing

step1.para: Check backlash between miter gears by turning the miter shaft with your fingers. Add or remove miter cover shims until zero backlash is obtained. The miter gears should be dry and free of grease for this adjustment ( Figure 124).

figure.caption: Figure 124. Add or Remove Miter Cover Shims Until Zero Backlash Obtained

step1.para: Install and tighten miter cover bolts. Install the miter lube fitting and fill miter with a good waterproof ball bearing grease (Figure 125). Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the correct grease.

figure.caption: Figure 125. Install and Tighten Miter Cover Bolts
